intro: Schefflera yuncacoyae, commonly known as the Yuncacoyá Schefflera, is a species native to Ecuador. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Araliaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, tropical forests. Its botanical features include palmately divided leaves and a preference for shaded, moist environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to biodiversity.
